given time should be made and displayed and credits must be given to the designer mass production of these designs is prohibited general information for crochet tatted lace cal designer ferosa harold here is a brief overview for the crochet tatted lace cal crochet tatted lace is a combination of crochet and needle tatting using one tool a special crochet hook is used to facilitate the execution of both crafts effortlessly the rings are made using the needle tatting double stitch ds and the rest is worked in crochet to begin learning this technique you must have a working knowledge of the basic crochet stitches chain single_crochet double_crochet treble_crochet slip_stitch the lessons will be visual and structured for both right and left-handed crocheters cal will start on the 25th september and will run for two weeks crochet tatted lace doily materials you will need for thread cro tat thread older hook or the new size 6 hook 1 ball of size 10 thread for yarn cro tat yarn hook size e if you have another size cro tat hook for yarn that will work also i skien cotton worsted weight yarn crochet tatted lace basics designer ferosa harold left handed instructions lesson 1 the double stitch fig 01 secure thread in right hand holding thread end against hook with left hand working anti- clockwise from right to left fig 02 wrap all the way around finger back to beginning make sure thread is crossed fig 03 make a fist place hook under thread of loop formed on index finger fig 04 slide thread off finger onto hook fig 05 pull thread snug on hook fig 06 secure thread in right hand between index and middle finger fig 07 wrap thread around index finger of right hand in a clockwise direction from left to right fig 08 make sure thread is crossed place hook under thread fig 09 slide thread off finger onto hook pull thread so stitch fits snug on hook the picot p fig 10 make first half of ds don t slide st next to last ds made leave a space of a quarter inch fig 11 make second half of ds slide ds next to previous ds made close ring fig 12 make 8 ds p 8 ds fig 13 pass ball thread over the back of right hand place right thumb on ball thread in front
